channel.title: Marshall Elementary School News
channel.description: News and announcements from Marshall Elementary School, including events, activities, and important dates.

item.title: Oxford Lions Club Glasses Donation Drive
item.description:
The Oxford Lions Club Sight Saving Committee is collecting used eyeglasses (including sunglasses) and glasses cases to donate to children worldwide. The lenses and frames are modified to meet individual children's eye needs, with the club sending 900+ pairs annually to children in need.

Donation details: Send glasses donations to Betsy Beaton (Marshall Elementary School) or Shaunna Tafelski (Board Office) by the beginning of December. Donations can be dropped off at Marshall or the Board Office.

Add to Calendar: Google Calendar | iCal | Outlook

View original newsletter

item.title: 2025-2026 Yearbook Order Form Available
item.description:
The 2025-2026 yearbook order form is now available for Talawanda High School students and families. Order forms can be accessed to purchase a copy of this year's yearbook.

View original newsletter

item.title: December Breakfast and Lunch Menus
item.description:
The December 2025 breakfast and lunch menus for Marshall Elementary are now available. Breakfast options include items like Apple Cinnamon Texas French Toast, Mini Chocolate Chip French Toast, Breakfast Pizza, Egg & Cheese English Muffin Sandwiches, and various donut options throughout the month. Lunch selections feature French Toast Sticks, Walking Taco with Doritos, Boneless Chicken Wings, Pizza Cruncher Bites, Mini Confetti Pancakes, Nachos with Taco Meat & Cheese, Holiday Meal with Roast Turkey and Gravy, Popcorn Chicken, and Chicken Patty on Bun. 100% fruit juice, assorted fruit, vegetables, and milk are included with every breakfast and lunch. Menus are subject to change based on product availability.

View original newsletter

item.title: Head Lice Check Before School Break
item.description:
The district nurse asks parents to check their children for head lice before the upcoming school break. Lice commonly spread during breaks, gatherings, and sleepovers. If lice or nits are found, please treat before returning to school. Information about head lice is available on the school website under Departments > School Nursing Offices. Contact District Nurse Tonja Fangman at fangmant@talawanda.org with questions.

View original newsletter

item.title: Tech Healthy Household Presentation Event
item.description:
Project Reboot presents "Keys to Building a Tech Healthy Household" on Tuesday, November 18th from 6-7:30 PM at Talawanda High School. The event features a 60-minute presentation plus 30-minute Q&A covering tech addiction (why it happens and how to overcome it), how to discuss screen time with kids without conflict, and practical tips for maintaining balanced relationships with technology. Hosted by Dino Ambrosi, founder of Project Reboot and digital wellness presenter, who created a course that helped 100+ UC Berkeley students reduce screen time by an average of 3.5 hours per day. All attendees receive actionable resources and dinner table discussion guides. ISD APPROVED. Event supported by Greater Oxford Community Foundation. More info: https://projectreboot.school

Add to Calendar: Google Calendar | iCal | Outlook

View original newsletter

item.title: Monthly PTG Meeting - November 10th
item.description:
Monthly PTG Meeting scheduled for November 10, 2025 from 6:00-7:00 PM in the Marshall Cafeteria. All are invited to attend this Parent-Teacher Group gathering.

item.title: November Breakfast and Lunch Menus
item.description:
The November 2025 breakfast and lunch menus are now available for Marshall Elementary. The breakfast menu includes items like Mini Chocolate Chip French Toast, Breakfast Burritos, Pancake on a Stick, and various donut options. 100% fruit juice, assorted fruit selection, and milk are included with every breakfast. The lunch menu features options such as Popcorn Chicken Dinner Roll, Mac & Cheese, Chicken Tenders, Pizza varieties, and a Holiday Meal with Roast Turkey and Gravy on November 19th. Choice of milk is included with every lunch. School is closed November 4, 24-25, and 26-28 for Thanksgiving break.

View original newsletter

item.title: Marshall Free Pantry for Students
item.description:
The Marshall Free Pantry is located at the front left side of the school near the gym doors and is open to all students. The pantry offers free food, hygiene products, and school supplies including veggies, fruit, pasta, soup, applesauce, snacks, school supplies, body wash, shampoo, and toothpaste. For questions, donations, or suggestions, contact Chrissy, Marshall Social Worker at 513-273-3611 or rolfesc@talawanda.org.

View original newsletter

item.title: PTG Thanks Families for Halloween Parade
item.description:
The Parent Teacher Group (PTG) thanks all families who attended their Halloween parade. They hope families enjoyed the coffee, doughnuts, and fellowship with Marshall families at the event. The message is accompanied by festive Halloween-themed pumpkin decorations.

View original newsletter

item.title: November Breakfast and Lunch Menus
item.description:
The November 2025 breakfast and lunch menus for Marshall Elementary are now available.

Breakfast includes items like Mini Chocolate Chip French Toast, pancakes, breakfast burritos, and donuts. 100% fruit juice, assorted fruit, and milk are included with every breakfast.

Lunch features options such as Popcorn Chicken Dinner Roll, Mac & Cheese, pizza varieties, chicken tenders, and a special Holiday Meal with Roast Turkey and Gravy on November 19th. Choice of milk is included with every lunch.

School is closed November 4th, 24th-28th for Thanksgiving break. Menus are subject to change based on product availability.

View original newsletter

item.title: Marshall Mondays School Spirit Initiative
item.description:
Marshall Mondays begin on October 20th and continue every Monday through the end of the school year. Students are encouraged to show school spirit and pride by wearing: - Talawanda gear - Marshall Elementary shirt - Red, white, and blue colors

Go Brave!

View original newsletter

item.title: Weather Reminders and Halloween Parade Information
item.description:
Marshall Mondays begin 10/20 - students should wear Talawanda gear, Marshall Elementary shirts, or red, white, and blue every Monday through the end of the year to show school spirit. As weather gets colder, please send students with warm coats and layers for outdoor recess. The annual Halloween Parade is Friday, October 31st at 9:30 a.m. - families can enjoy free doughnuts and purchase coffee/hot chocolate starting at 9:00 a.m., with the parade beginning at 9:25 in the back lot.

Marshall Mondays Begin

item.title: Marshall Free Pantry for Students
item.description:
The Marshall Free Pantry is located at the front left side of the school near the gym doors and provides free food, hygiene products, and school supplies to all students. Available items include veggies, fruit, pasta, soup, applesauce, snacks, school supplies, body wash, shampoo, and toothpaste. For questions, donations, or suggestions, contact Chrissy, Marshall Social Worker at 513-273-3611 or rolfesc@talawanda.org.

View original newsletter

item.title: Marshall PTG Events and Fundraising Overview
item.description:
The Marshall Parent Teacher Group (PTG) supports Marshall Elementary through community building and educational initiatives. Current fundraisers include Fall Mum Flower Sale, Glow Dance Party Boosterthon, Spring Flower Sale, and Box Tops for Education.

Upcoming events for the 2025-2026 school year include: - Marshall Open House PTG Booth & Staff Luncheon - Tuesday, August 12, 2025, 4:30-6:00 PM - PTG Marshall T-Shirt sales - Back to School Family Skate - Sunday, September 21, 2025, 3:00-4:30 PM - Fall Staff Conference Meals - October 14 & 16, 2025 - Back from Break Family Skate - Sunday, January 11, 2026, 3:00-4:30 PM - Spring Staff Conference Meals - March 12 & 17, 2026 - Marshall Spring Fling Dance - Friday, April 24, 2026, 6:00-8:00 PM - Staff Appreciation Week - May 6-8, 2026 - Mayfest - Friday, May 15, 2026, 6:00-9:00 PM

PTG also supports field trips, R.A.H., general funding requests, and music receptions throughout the year.

Marshall Open House PTG Booth & Staff Luncheon

item.title: Pre-Halloween Parade Coffee and Donuts
item.description:
Join PTG before the Marshall Halloween Parade for free donuts (provided by Oxford Donuts) and community gathering. Coffee and hot chocolate available for purchase from Rambling Roast. Event runs 9:00-9:30am on Friday, October 31 at the shelter house near the overflow parking lot. The group will head to the bay loop at 9:30am to watch the parade together. Costumes welcome!

Add to Calendar: Google Calendar | iCal | Outlook

View original newsletter

item.title: Tech Healthy Household Presentation by Project Reboot
item.description:
Project Reboot presents "Keys to Building a Tech Healthy Household" on Tuesday, November 18th from 6-7:30 PM at Talawanda High School. This PSD-approved event features a 60-minute presentation plus 30 minutes of Q&A covering tech addiction (why it happens and how to overcome it), how to discuss screen time with kids without eye rolling, and practical tips for maintaining balanced relationships with technology. Hosted by Dino Ambrosi, Founder of Project Reboot (https://projectreboot.school), a digital wellness presenter who helped 100+ UC Berkeley students reduce screen time by an average of 3.5 hours per day. All attendees receive actionable take-home resources and dinner table discussion guides. Event supported by Greater Oxford Community Foundation.

Add to Calendar: Google Calendar | iCal | Outlook

View original newsletter

item.title: Kiwanis K-Kids Food Drive for Local Families
item.description:
Kiwanis K-Kids is hosting a food drive from Monday, October 20th through Friday, October 31st to help feed local families in need. Donations will provide fresh meals and groceries to families who go to bed hungry each day.

Items needed include: - Instant mashed potatoes (any flavor) - Stuffing mix - Gravy pouches - Soup (cream of mushroom, cream of chicken) - Canned vegetables (beans, corn, mixed vegetables)

The class with the most donated items will win a pizza party!

Add to Calendar: Google Calendar | iCal | Outlook

View original newsletter

item.title: Kindergarten Meet & Greet Event
item.description:
Kindergarten Meet & Greet on Sunday, October 12, 2025, 3-4 pm at Marshall Playground. This outdoor event welcomes all kindergarten students and families to play and socialize while introducing new Marshall kindergarteners to their friends and other parents. Small snacks and water will be provided by Marshall PTG. The event is outdoors only with no building access, meeting at both playground areas. Rain date: October 19, 3-4pm. TSD approved for distribution.

item.title: FCCLA Trunk or Treat Event
item.description:
FCCLA is sponsoring Trunk or Treat at Talawanda High School on Tuesday, October 28th from 6:00-7:30 PM. The event is approved for distribution by ISD. If you or your organization would like to hand out treats from a "trunk spot," scan the QR code or use the sign-up link provided. Sign up here

item.title: October Breakfast and Lunch Menus
item.description:
The October 2025 breakfast and lunch menus for Marshall Elementary are now available.

Breakfast includes 100% fruit juice, assorted fruit selection, and milk with every meal. Daily options include items like egg & cheese bagel sandwiches, pancakes, breakfast burritos, french toast bites, biscuits & sausage gravy, and breakfast pizza. There is a Fall Break with no school on October 17th.

Lunch includes choice of milk with every meal. Daily options feature main dishes like chicken alfredo, chicken tenders, pizza, corn dogs, taco bites, quesadillas, chicken nuggets, and various sides including fresh vegetables, fruits, and salads. Special days include Try It Tuesday on October 14th and National Apple Day on October 21st with walking tacos and Doritos. Fall Break continues October 17th, and Halloween is October 31st with themed meals.

Fall Break - No School
